Race.SpecificTitle: Constable -- Justice of the Peace Ward 1
Chief of Police -- Town of Roseland
Council Member -- District 2, Town of Amite City
City of Hammond HRC -- HRC Amendment - City of Hammond - CC
Race.SummaryText:
City of Hammond Proposition

Summary:  Article VI of the Hammond City Charter provides for a Citizen Initiative Referendum by the citizens of Hammond.  On March 24, 2008, the Hammond City Council was presented with a Citizen Initiative Referendum Petition proposing the elimination of electronic video bingo in the City of Hammond effective January 1, 2009. The Hammond City Council certified this Referendum Petition as having the required number of signatures of registered voters as provided in the City Charter.  In accordance with the City Charter, on September 16, 2008, the Hammond City Council voted to submit the matter to the voters of the City at the November 4, 2008 general election.
Race.FullText: Shall electronic video bingo as now defined in Title IV, Chapter 11 of the revised statutes of the State of Louisiana be prohibited in the City of Hammond effective January 1, 2009?

Race.SpecificTitle: Ponchatoula Rec. Dist.1 -- 4 Mills - BOC - 30 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Ponchatoula Area Recreation District No. 1 Proposition

Summary:  Levy and collection of a four (4.00) mills, thirty (30) year property tax by the Ponchatoula Area Recreation District No. 1 of the Parish of Tangipahoa, State of Louisiana, for the purpose of providing funds to acquire, improve and equip a multipurpose gymnasium facility and other recreation facilities within the Ponchatoula Area Recreation District No. 1 of the Parish of Tangipahoa, State of Louisiana, to pay the operation and maintenance costs and expenses in connection therewith, and to authorize the funding of the proceeds of said tax into bonds.
Race.FullText: Shall the Ponchatoula Area Recreation District No. 1 of the Parish of Tangipahoa, State of Louisiana (the "Recreation District No. 1"), under the provisions of Article VI, Section 32 of the Louisiana Constitution of 1974, as amended, Chapter 11 of Title 33 of the Louisiana Revised Statutes of 1950, as amended, and other constitutional and statutory authority supplemental thereto, be authorized to levy and collect, and adopt an ordinance providing for such levy and collection, of a special ad valorem tax of four (4.00) mills on the dollar of assessed valuation on all property subject to taxation within the boundaries of the Recreation District No. 1 (the "Tax") (an estimated $307,000 is reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of thirty (30) years, beginning with the tax collection for the year 2009, and annually thereafter to and including the year 2038, the proceeds of said Tax to provide funds to the Recreation District No. 1 to be used entirely and exclusively to acquire, improve and equip a multipurpose gymnasium facility and other recreational facilities within Recreation District No. 1, and to provide funds to pay the operation and maintenance costs and expenses in connection therewith; and shall the Recreation District No. 1 be further authorized to fund proceeds of the Tax into bonds from time to time to the extent and in the manner permitted by the laws of Louisiana?
